Calling all substitute teachers: Join the LTISD family today!

Substitutes provide an invaluable service to our students in all subjects and all grade levels, both in general and special education settings. LTISD is committed to ensuring that we not only have the highest caliber substitute teachers, but also, that our substitutes have appropriate resources to maximize their success in the classroom. Pay ranges between $95-$150 per day, depending on certification and assignment.

Qualifications:
-At least 60 college credit hours, as documented by official transcripts
-Successful completion of the District’s substitute orientation,
Substitute University

All candidates must complete an online application in order to be considered for a position. To get started, visit www.ltisdschools.org, then select “Careers.” For more information, call 512-533-6009.

Parents: Any student who checked out a District-issued Chromebook for remote learning at home and will return to in-person learning on campus on September 8 or September 21 should retain the device and bring it to school for use in the classroom as needed, much like an assigned textbook. Chromebooks will remain checked out to the student until a date to be later determined or at the end of the 2020–2021 school year, whichever comes first. Please note, any damaged or broken Chromebook assigned to a student will be addressed through a Technology work order to be submitted by the student’s teacher; for middle and high school students, this will be done by the 2nd period teacher.

Students may also bring an approved device from home for in-person learning. Doing so will help students make a smoother transition to in-person learning using an established device. Students who did not check out a District-issued device will have access to Chromebooks at school for in-person learning.

Parents: To prepare for in-person learning on campus, all Lake Travis ISD teachers will participate in professional development on Friday, August 28 and Friday, September 4.

Specifically, teachers will prepare their classrooms for in-person learning and receive training on a number of items including safety protocols and the delivery of instruction for both in-person and remote learners. As a result, elementary students will receive real-time, live instruction (synchronous teaching) through 10:00 a.m. as teachers prepare them for the rest of the day to be self-paced (asynchronous). Secondary students will complete asynchronous (self-paced) assignments only. Parents should note that learning will be temporarily modified as described for all students on Friday, August 28 and Friday, September 4.

We kindly ask that you and your students plan accordingly and contact your teacher(s) directly with any questions or concerns.

post_text: Superintendent Dr. Brad Lancaster is pleased to announce the selection of Mrs. Pamela Schaeffer as the new principal of Lake Travis Elementary School, effective July 1. She possesses over 20 years of professional experience in public education having served as a teacher, curriculum specialist, reading instructor, literacy coordinator, assistant principal and principal in the Terrell, Crandall, and Frisco school districts. Currently, Mrs. Schaeffer is concluding the school year as Principal of Shawnee Trail Elementary School in Frisco where she has served for the past six years. We welcome Mrs. Schaeffer to the LT family! Read the full release: https://bit.ly/2KIccTV #LTWorkofHeart

Scott Banaski, Key Account Manager with Austin Energy (pictured third from left), presented a check for $1,222.65 to Robert Winovitch, LTISD Director of Facilities and Construction (pictured second from left) made possible by voluntary contributions by City of Austin utility customers to the Public School Energy Assistance Fund.

The fund is divided between the eight school districts served by Austin Energy. According to Austin Energy, the allocation of the fund is based on each school district's percentage of the total kilowatt-hours of electricity consumed by the eight school districts. The fund was created by direction of the Austin City Council during deliberations to establish electric rates for Austin Energy. City of Austin utility customers began making donations to the fund in March 2013 through their monthly utility payments. This reimbursement covers the period of October 2018 through August 2019.

Also pictured are Richard Harrison (far left) and Wesley Perkins (far right), each of whom serves as Facility Resources, Compliance and Construction Manager for Lake Travis ISD.

post_text: LTHS senior Emily Padilla was selected to receive a $500 college scholarship for her performance in the Girls Go CyberStart competition. GGCS is a series of online interactive challenges designed to empower girls across the country to become the next leaders in cyber security. Encouraging young women to learn about STEM careers has also become a priority for local legislators as evidenced by the passing of Texas House Bill 3435 which designates March 1 as ‘Texas Girls in STEM Day.’ Lake Travis High School had six students participate in the competition. Their team—LT CyberCavs—placed in the top 50. Over 11,000 female students from 27 states participated in the event.

post_text: Today, we celebrated the official opening of Bee Cave Middle School during a ribbon cutting ceremony held at the campus. BCMS staff, PTO, students and their families, together with district administration, and local and state dignitaries spent the afternoon commemorating this significant addition to our district. The $76.2 million facility was designed by Fields & Associates Architects and built by American Constructors, both of whom are headquartered in Austin. The 240,000 square foot campus accommodates 870 students with a capacity for 1,200 in two-story, grade-level houses with hill country views. It features outdoor science and art areas, an outdoor gathering space, abundant natural light, and multipurpose breakout areas that allow for flexibility and collaboration. The project is part of the district’s $253 million bond program approved by voters in November 2017. #RaiderPride #LTWorkofHeart

Parents: we are excited to introduce Skyward Family Access, a new student information system that will provide a more user-friendly experience, especially at back-to-school time!

With the theme “Occupational Therapy: Making the Impossible, Possible,” LTISD joins the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA) to celebrate April as National Occupational Therapy Month in recognition of the critical role OTs play in both school and clinical settings.

Occupational Therapists (OTs) are licensed professionals who help to improve the quality of life for individuals of all ages. School-based OTs support academic achievement and social participation by promoting occupation within school routines including recess, classroom, and cafeteria time. They utilize strategies for health and well being of students and prepare them for college, career, and community integration.

The following Occupational Therapists serve students across LTISD:

Quina Brown - SHE, BCE, WCHE
Cat Daniel - LTE, LWE, HBMS
Mary Owen - LPE, LTMS, LTHS

Lake Travis High School students will have 24 works of art, created by 22 students, juried at the state Visual Art Scholastic Event (VASE) to be held April 27 in San Marcos. post_text: Lake Travis High School student-athlete Garrett Wilson has been selected to play in the 2019 All-American Bowl. Garrett, committed to the Ohio State Buckeyes, is one of only 100 high school seniors across the country invited to participate and becomes the first ever Lake Travis High School Football player to receive the honor. He joins the likes of former and current NFL athletes including Vince Young, Tim Tebow, Andrew Luck, Ezekiel Elliott, Adrian Peterson, and Odell Beckham Jr. as past participants. Be sure to watch Garrett live at noon, Saturday, Jan. 5, 2019 from the Alamodome in San Antonio. The game will be televised nationally on NBC. Congratulations to the Wilson family, way to present Lake Travis and the Cavaliers! #LearnTogetherLeadTogetherLT #LeaveNoDoubt

Way to go student-athletes! #LearnTogetherLeadTogetherLT
